document_data.name: Dhalmass Obarskyr
document_data.titles:
King
The Warrior King{{Cite dragon/281/The New Adventures of Volo: Lost Treasures of Cormyr, Part 4|77}}
document_data.children: [[Palaghard Obarskyr II]], at least one other son
document_data.mainbody: '''Dhalmass Obarskyr''', known as '''the Warrior King''', was a king of [[Cormyr]] from [[1210 DR]] to [[1227 DR]]. He was the sole heir of [[Pryntaler Obarskyr]] and the father of [[Palaghard Obarskyr II|Palaghard II]]. He was remembered in history for reconquering [[Marsember]].
document_data.Description:
Dhalmass was a towering figure—about {{SI|6.5|ft|long=yes}}, give or take—with broad shoulders and a muscular build. He wore his white-blond hair long, with a huge beard and bushy eyebrows. He had cold blue eyes that flared when he was angry and a large, aquiline nose. His voice was deep and could be heard a great distance even over the clashing of a battlefield.

King Dhalmass Obarskyr's likeness was immortalized in a famous thought the realms statue called ''King Dhalmass Surveying the Realm''. The pompous image of the King was standing chest first with balled fists on his waist and his chin lifted high. There were several copies made and displayed across Cormyr. One such stature could be found in the gardens of the village of [[Espar]].
document_data.Abilities: Dhalmass was enormously strong and was able to move his huge frame extremely fast.
document_data.Relationships: He was the son and sole heir of King [[Pryntaler Obarskyr|Pryntaler]]. Dhalmass was the husband of Queen [[Jhalass Huntsilver]]. They had four children: [[Proster Obarskyr (prince)|Proster]] (born [[1213 DR]], died [[1222 DR]], aged 9), [[Palaghard Obarskyr II|Palaghard]] (born [[1214 DR]]), [[Elliira Obarskyr|Elliira]] (born [[1218 DR]]), and [[Pelara Obarskyr|Pelara]] (born [[1220 DR]]).<ref>
document_data.History:
Dhalmass became king in the {{YearlinkName|1211}} after the death of his father the in the previous year.{{Dhalmass date}}

One of his famous deeds was leading a company of mounted knights and soldiers against a horde of [[orc]]s that outnumbered his forces ten-to-one. He accomplished this by constantly keeping his band on the move, switching horses at every castle he could, and picking off orc patrols and marauding mobs whenever they were encountered.

In the {{YearlinkName|1216}}, he executed the last noble of the [[Goldfeather]] family for treason.

After the port city of Marsember rebelled, King Dhalmass seized it back in the {{YearlinkName|1227}}.

He was succeeded by his second son, Palaghard II.
